data.title: Nardin Academy Students Return to Classroom Amid New COVID-19 Rules
data.meta_description: The school began testing students Saturday to meet the state's guidelines.
data.text:
Students at Nardin Academy are back inside the classroom Monday after recent changes to the state's COVID-19 regulations.

Schools in red and orange zones now have an option to return students to the classroom as long as strict testing protocols are followed.

For schools in the Erie County orange zone, 20% of all in-person students, faculty, and staff need to be tested during the course of a month. If nine or more tests come back positive, the school will switch to remote learning.

Nardin Academy began testing students Saturday to meet the state's guidelines.

Family volunteers and health care professionals were at the school's gym and wellness center, which was transformed into a COVID-19 testing site.

Schools in the orange zone that return to in-person classes also need to follow guidelines like wearing masks and completing a daily survey.
